page.title: 01The Hinterland of Kirkhill
page.content: The area is very rural - good farmland, woods and forests. There are no large commercial or industrial operations. The land is flat around Kirkhill rising to the back at Cabrich and Knockbain. Running across the middle of the block is the A862 until recently the A9 the main road to the north from Inverness. However since the opening of the Kessock Bridge the traffic now crosses the Black Isle making this area much quieter. The village of Kirkhill is the main centre of population very close to the Beauly Firth. Monaick Castle recently renovated has begun producing wines from local products, fruits, berries, plants etc. from the countryside. The latest addition is a restaurent & wine bar. There is a beautiful woodland walk through the forest at Moniack owned by the Forestry Commission.
